chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
m: X -> X -> X
u: X
Hmonoid: monoid_theory m u
n: nat
f: nat -> X

Goal:
(forall i : nat, 0 < i <= n -> f i = u) -> ∑ (n + 2) f = f 0 ⊕ f (S n)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
monoid_theory : forall X : Type, (X -> X -> X) -> X -> Prop
msum_sum : forall (n : nat) (f g : nat -> X), (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> f j ⊕ g i = g i ⊕ f j) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i ⊕ g i) = ∑ n f ⊕ ∑ n g
msum_of_unit : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i = u) -> ∑ n f = u
msum_comm : forall (a : X) (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i ⊕ a = a ⊕ f i) -> ∑ n f ⊕ a = a ⊕ ∑ n f
msum_only_one : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X) (i : nat), i < n -> (forall j : nat, j < n -> i <> j -> f j = u) -> ∑ n f = f i
msum_ext : forall (n : nat) (f g : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i = g i) -> ∑ n f = ∑ n g
msum_msum : forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> nat -> X), (forall i1 j1 i2 j2 : nat, i1 < n -> j1 < k -> i2 < n -> j2 < k -> f i1 j1 ⊕ f i2 j2 = f i2 j2 ⊕ f i1 j1) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => ∑ k (f i)) = ∑ k (fun j : nat => ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i j))
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t ?n) -> Fin.t (p + ?m) -> Fin.t (p + ?n) where ?m : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat f : nat -> X |- nat] ?n : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat f : nat -> X |- nat]
msum_plus : forall (a b : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ (a + b) f = ∑ a f ⊕ ∑ b (fun i : nat => f (a + i))
msum = fix msum (n : nat) (f : nat -> X) {struct n} : X := match n with | 0 => u | S n0 => f 0 ⊕ msum n0 (fun n1 : nat => f (S n1)) end : nat -> (nat -> X) -> X Arguments msum _%nat_scope _%function_scope
msum_S : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ (S n) f = f 0 ⊕ ∑ n (fun n0 : nat => f (S n0))
msum_plus1 : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ (S n) f = ∑ n f ⊕ f n
VectorDef.splitat : forall l r : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (l + r) -> VectorDef.t ?A l * VectorDef.t ?A r where ?A : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u n : nat f : nat -> X |- Type]
msum_1 : forall f : nat -> X, ∑ 1 f = f 0
msum_0 : forall f : nat -> X, ∑ 0 f = u
msum_fold_map : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ n f = fold_right m u (map f (list_an 0 n))
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
monoid_unit_l : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m u x = x
monoid_unit_r : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m x u = x
monoid_assoc : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z
measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker_sound : forall (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof), ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker f w = true -> forall env : RingMicromega.PolEnv Z, Tauto.eval_bf (ZMicromega.Zeval_formula env) f
Nat.add_nonneg_nonneg : forall n m : nat, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> 0 <= n + m
Nat.mul_lt_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : nat, 0 <= n -> n < m -> 0 <= p -> p < q -> n * p < m * q
Nat.bi_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A n <-> A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
Nat.mul_pos_pos : forall n m : nat, 0 < n -> 0 < m -> 0 < n * m
Nat.testbit_odd_succ : forall a n : nat, 0 <= n -> Nat.testbit (2 * a + 1) (S n) = Nat.testbit a n
gcd.bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
map_map : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (l : list A), map g (map f l) = map (fun x : A => g (f x)) l
Nat.log2_nonpos : forall n : nat, n <= 0 -> Nat.log2 n = 0
Nat.lt_alt = fun n m : nat => exists p : nat, S p + n = m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.lt_alt (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.log2_mul_above : forall a b : nat, 0 <= a -> 0 <= b -> Nat.log2 (a * b) <= Nat.log2 a + Nat.log2 b + 1
gcd.rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> gcd.rem a p = a
gcd.is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides r p /\ gcd.divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides k p -> gcd.divides k q -> gcd.divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.pow_neg_r : forall a b : nat, b < 0 -> a ^ b = 0
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker = fun (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof) => Tauto.tauto_checker ZMicromega.Zunsat ZMicromega.Zdeduce ZMicromega.normalise ZMicromega.negate (fun cl : list (RingMicromega.NFormula Z * unit) => ZMicromega.ZChecker (map fst cl)) f w : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula Z) -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> bool Arguments ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker _ _%list_scope
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
plus_is_one : forall m n : nat, m + n = 1 -> {m = 0 /\ n = 1} + {m = 1 /\ n = 0}
gcd.euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
Nat.log2_up_succ_double : forall a : nat, 0 < a -> Nat.log2_up (2 * a + 1) = 2 + Nat.log2 a
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p

intros i H.
apply msum_plus1.
apply msum_only_one; auto.
intros j G1 G2.
destruct j.
- inversion G1.
- lia.
